column4: does anyone know how i can force ubuntu to boot to tty rather than gui?
don't use gdm
where can i specify that? i'm looking in startup applications
it's a daemon, install something like rcconf to change it
when i run rcconf, gdm isn't enabled
you could just aptitude remove gdm
im setting up an ubuntu server for the first time and i wanna use tty but im still new and wanna keep the safety of gnome
you can keep gnome
the only way i know how to start gnome is /etc/init.d/gdm start
sounds like removing gdm removes that too
it would, but you could aptitude install gdm if you wanted it back
rather than that i thought there would be a nice little config file somewhere oh well, ill hafta research
gdm should be listed in rcconf if it's running
it's listed but it isn't checked
try sysv-rc-conf
it's like rcconf but a little more advanced
gdm is again listed with nothing enabled for it at all levels
weird :O
hmm.. and it does boot to the graphical login when you restart?
yeah im gunna reboot again and see wut happens
k
yeah just booted in to x
maybe if i disable "X11-common" ?
